bibl.title: What's in a Line? Papyrus Formats and Hephaestionic Formulae.
bibl.note: See in part. pp. 308-310: gives some examples on papyri which do not correctly reflect metrical structures (The Sapphic stanza; - Alcaeus 130b Voigt; - Alcaeus 140 Voigt; - Anacreon 346 PMG; - Pindar, Paean 9; - Bacchylides Papyrus A; - The Cologne Archilochus).

bibl.title: Hesperos. Studies in Ancient Greek Poetry Presented to M.L. West on his Seventieth Birthday

bibl.seg: ITSUMI Kiichiro, What's in a Line? Papyrus Formats and Hephaestionic Formulae.
P.J. FINGLASS, C. COLLARD and N.J. RICHARDSON (Edd.), Hesperos. Studies in Ancient Greek Poetry Presented to M.L. West on his Seventieth Birthday (Oxford, 2007) pp. 306-325.

See in part. pp. 308-310: gives some examples on papyri which do not correctly reflect metrical structures (The Sapphic stanza; - Alcaeus 130b Voigt; - Alcaeus 140 Voigt; - Anacreon 346 PMG; - Pindar, Paean 9; - Bacchylides Papyrus A; - The Cologne Archilochus).
